allow:
Bash(git commit --amend -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: remove abs\(\) from expand_kt_to_canonical that destroyed Kt sign info

The abs\(\)/-abs\(\) convention in expand_kt_to_canonical silently flipped
signs when the solver found negative Kt values, producing incorrect
displayed/exported Kt that could not reconstruct stress correctly.

Now INDIVIDUAL/SET entries pass through raw solver coefficients and
LINKED entries use raw/-raw \(not abs\(raw\)/-abs\(raw\)\) for the +/- split.
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: enforce consistent sign convention with Kt ≥ 0 across all modes

Fixes fundamental inconsistencies where LINKED mode used signed forces but flipped
Kt signs in display, while INDIVIDUAL mode stripped signs from forces, requiring
negative Kt values to compensate. This made the physics confusing and violated the
principle that stress concentration factors are non-negative geometric properties.

Changes:
- Enforce Kt ≥ 0 in LP bounds \(physically meaningful\)
- LINKED mode: display same Kt for Fx+ and Fx- \(no sign flip\)
- INDIVIDUAL/SET modes: preserve signs in force matrix \(remove abs\(\)\)
- Update validation to use consistent signed physics
- Add comprehensive tests for new behavior
- Document sign conventions in CLAUDE.md

Breaking change: Kt values will differ from previous versions and physically
inconsistent data \(opposite force/stress signs\) will now be correctly rejected.
All automated tests verify the new consistent behavior.
EOF
\)")
